sub_title: BIM Engineer Bouwkunde at BAM Bouw Techniek
summary:
A passionate person with a desire to take on new challenges. With a great interest in architecture, BIM, and W-installation technology. Excited to gain more experience and improve my technical and design knowledge. My main goal is to learn the whole process of BIM engineer/manager and improve my digital skills. In addition to upgrading my professional level of communication skills and critical thinking in the design process. I have the drive and desire to further develop myself and am willing to go beyond my limits to excel in my chosen profession.

Specialties:

Architectural Design and Planning: Commercial, Residential, and Apartment Projects 

Master Planning, Detail Design, Construction Drawing, Cost Estimation, Scheduling

Urban Design and Planning: Sustainable Development, Land Use Planning

education.field_of_study: in Land Issue/ Public Facility Development/ Zoning and Building Regulation

awards.title: Attended conference of the Science 4 Refugees
awards.description: The Science4Refugees initiative is directed towards refugees researchers/scientists who have applied for and been granted asylum in a host country, which will enable them to continue their educational path or enter the labor market. Under the header "Science4Refugees" a number of initiatives will be brought together on the EURAXESS portal. I was invited to participate this conference after passing the eligibility of having the ability of working in the Eupropean Union.

awards.title: Presenting Thesis Paper (Do the determinants of happiness differ between immigrants and home stayers? A comparison between Afghans in The Netherlands and Kabul) to the conference "A World to Win"
awards.description:
The theme of the first two days of the conference was The Happy Economy. The start of the conference on Monday 20 March has been consciously chosen to coincide with the 5th anniversary of the official UN International Day of Happiness on that day. After the first two days around The Happy Economy, the theme of the third day will be The Good Economy, and of the last two days The Examined Economy. 
My thesis paper was accepted to be presented at the conference on the day of the Good Economy.

projects.title: Case Study of Feijenoord Neighborhood
projects.description:
Revamping Feijenoord Neighbourhood in terms of Social, Environment & Finance”

Improve the overall character of the neighborhood in next five years by enhancing and expanding green spaces to increase social cohesion, safety, and reduce UHI effects. A more inclusive neighborhood by using the professionals, diverse cultures, arts & cuisines to create attractiveness and jobs as well as cooperation of Municipality for improving, maintaining and securing liveability.

profile_positions.description: Meta-analysis of scientific studies and researches on Happiness and Subjective well-being of migrants using the World Database of Happiness.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
I have been working under the direct supervision of Urban Design Specialist.

Duties/Responsibilities:
•	Focal point for Greenery Master Planning of Kabul New City.
•	Manage and organize the tasks and update a detail work plan (weekly, monthly and annually).
•	Develop and introduce manuals, tools, guidelines and standards for the development of Kabul New City.
•	Develop, review and finalization of terms of references for Kabul New City detailed plan and urban design projects.
•	Participate in drafting of Request for Proposals for implementation of detailed plans and urban design projects for Kabul New City.
•	Review and finalize the received developmental plan, urban detail designs with related technical documents of contractors.
•	Conduct and review research works in urban planning and design fields.
•	 land development concepts and urbanization trends. 
•	Develop and design various urban land use components on different scale levels.
•	Coordinate and manage urban design works with ministries and other internal divisions.
•	Assist other team members for the efficient planning and design of Kabul New City urban areas.
•	Review master plan, structure plan and detail developmental plan of entire urban area. 
•	Develop integrated land use models and land use plans.
•	Develop and design sustainable residential, commercial and industrial neighborhoods, districts, zones etc. based on urban designing principles. 
•	Preparation of weekly technical meetings and drafts amendments and recommendations in all urban design related issues.
•	Respond to stakeholders’ questions through written and oral communications in regard to the urban design issues.
•	Assists and coordinate DCDA urban planning activities with JICA technical team. 
•	Preparation of comprehensive technical reports.
•	Performs other duties as assigned.
profile_positions.title: Urban Designer

profile_positions.location: European Union Delegation For Afghanistan Share Naw
profile_positions.description:
Architectural Designing
•	Designing of residential houses projects.
•	Establishing building design according to international building codes.
Interior Design  
•	Inspecting forms for proper plumbing, electrical and mechanical works.  
Landscape Design 
•	Checking, compiling and verification of all site work’s to meet the codes (both local and International).
Exterior
•	Checking and testing of exterior walls or windows and doors for leakage and wind resistance.
•	Testing and inspection of glazing and wind-proofing to meet blueprint specs.
•	Verification of uniformity of masonry, plaster, tile wall, metal or any other exterior surfaces.
profile_positions.title: Architect/Planner

profile_positions.description:
Working on Kabul Grand Residence buildings and Marriott Hotel as a QC Architect/ MEP-Site Finishing Engineer on following duties and responsibilities: 
•	Establishing designs according to the national codes. 
•	Inspections of the site for proper plumbing, electrical and mechanical work. 
•	Inspection of all Interior, Exterior surfaces and landscape works to meet the blueprints and specifications.
profile_positions.title: Architect/QC and MEP/ Site Finishing Engineer

profile_positions.location: Behind Soryia High School, Karta-e-Char Kabul City, AFG
profile_positions.description: Designing, supporting, troubleshooting and maintaining of architectural master site plans and design drawing and construction detailing with an international law firm. Maintaining a stellar reputation for quality and efficiency in customer satisfaction, communication, and problem resolution. Proven ability to create and deliver solutions that meet objectives tied to business and technology performance and International standards while working with a wide range of projects and in a fast-paced environment for Afghan Security Forces and US Corps of Engineering (USACE).
profile_positions.title: Design Architect/Planner

profile_positions.description:
AR303 - Architectural Design- I
Architectural design focusing upon the application of elements and principles of form, space, and order in design. Instruction in the synthesis of basic social, functional, technical and aesthetic factors in design. Continued integration of material from Architectural Drawings and instruction in non-digital techniques for visually representing design ideas.
Prerequisite: AR202 (Introduction to Architecture-II)
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant at Faculty of Engineering, Kabul University

profile_positions.description:
•	Providing assistance, support and problem resolution to solar system Firm including support-related training and assistance of solar system supported documents for Afghan Clean Energy Program(ACEP) around Afghanistan.
•	Maintaining good working knowledge and usability of solarsystemsupported documents, hardware, software and preparing Annual report writing, and E-mailing to Win Rock International, IRG, and USAID.
•	Maintaining inventory of (KURB)Lab for 120 student + users workstations.
•	Coordinating and acquiring outsourced repairing and installation of solar system and lantern evaluation services around Afghanistan.
profile_positions.title: Intern Solar Engineer

company.name: Faculty of Engineering at Kabul University

volunteer_experiences.description: We were a group of students who were working to prepare landscape plans of the Engineering Faculty at Kabul University and finding sources for funding the project and also implementing the plans.

I was working volunteer for a semester at Architecture Department of Engineering Faculty at Kabul University as candidate assistant professor with Professor. March. Hemayatullah Azizi on subject of Architectural Design for the 2nd year Architectural Students of the Faculty.
I was mostly engaged to prepare presentations for the students, announcement of home works, events, site visits and collecting assignments papers for corrections, correction of home works, quizzes, and term exams with professor.
Assisting students to rectify their design course deficits with their lecture notes, assignments and their final projects.
